topic.title: SGML tags for markup table header

body.p: The following table contains the definition of the SGML tags that you can use in a markup table header.

table.title: SGML tags for markup table header

row.entry: Specifies a markup table description, which is shown in the Markup Table Properties window and the Markup Table List window.

Specifies a descriptive name for this markup table. For example, the specification of <DESCRNAME>ASCII</DESCRNAME> in the markup table EQFASCII would give it the name ASCII. If nothing is specified, the file name of the markup table is used.

Specifies the character set to be used for import and export of documents that use this markup table. The documents will be converted using the selected character set without the need to do the conversion in a user exit. Specify one of the following character sets: ASCII
ANSI
UTF8
UNICODE
Specifies the substitution character to use for single character substitution. The default character is ?.
Specifies the substitution character to use for multiple character substitution. The default character is %.

Specifies whether segmented source and target files in subdirectories SSOURCE and STARGET are stored in Unicode UTF-16 format. Specify one of the following: YES
NO This is the default.

Specifies whether CRLF are allowed to be changed during translation or not. EQFMRI is an example of a markup where RELOW is specified and set to NO. Specify one of the following: YES This is the default. NO
Contains the name of the user exit, if the markup table uses one.
